In the provided excerpt, Kaitlyn explains her method for creating study plans by stating that she doesn't make study plans or timetables but instead creates lists for the whole revision period, then the week, and finally the day. The visuals also show a close-up of a whiteboard with a to-do list on it, which includes items like “Accounting for 1-6 lectures & textbooks” and “Marketing essay plans (basic),” as well as shots of her writing with colorful pens and a notebook organized by days. This indicates that she organizes her studying by creating detailed lists and visual aids to help her stay focused and motivated during the revision process.
